citeinfo.origin: Arizona State Land Department, Arizona Land Resources Information System
citeinfo.title: Major Rivers

pubinfo.publish: Arizona State Land Department, Arizona Land Resources Information System

citeinfo.onlink: \\mainlib\data1\Teams\RSS\RSS Shared\AZ Geospatial Data Maps\Migration to UAiR\Exported Shapefiles\Major Rivers\Major Rivers.shp

descript.abstract: Data layer depicts major rivers. Converted in the fall of 1988 from USGS 1:100,000 scale DLG data to ARC format. Since then, multiple and extensive corrections have taken place. Early on, several Arizona agencies were part of rectification including: attributes, features, edgematching and the re-tiling of the data into the USGS Hydrologic Unit Code (HUC) library tiling format. The Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) has since added critical attributes to the Arizona database, including: A nationally recognized management link code (the Reach Id), names, and hydrologic information. Arizona has enhanced the theme further by adding ergonomic Descriptive Attribute Codes, Cartographic Order, more Names, and intense Quality Assurance Controls.
descript.purpose: The data are created to serve as base information for use in GIS systems for a variety of planning and analysis purposes. These data do not represent a legal record.

idinfo.accconst: Access is granted to public agencies, educational institutions, non-profit organizations and private individuals for non-commercial purpose. For commercial use of the data see Arizona Revised Statutes 39-121.03
idinfo.useconst: The Arizona State Land Department makes no warranties, implied or expressed, with respect to the accuracy of and the use of this data for any specific purpose. Users are required to make their own assessment of the data for any specific use.

cntorgp.cntorg: Arizona State Land Department, Arizona Land Resources Information System

cntinfo.hours: Monday-Friday, 8 AM - 5 PM, Mountain Standard Time

idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 3; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.3.1.3000

horizpa.horizpar: Approximate horizontal accuracy is 12 meters, assuming source data meets National Map Accuracy Standards.

citeinfo.title: Ephemeral and Perennial Streams in Arizona

pubinfo.publish: Arizona State Land Department, Arizona Land Resources Information System

srcinfo.srccontr: Converted in the fall of 1988 from USGS 1:100,000 scale DLG data to ARC format. Since then, multiple and extensive corrections have taken place. Early on, several Arizona agencies were part of rectification including: attributes, features, edgematching and the re-tiling of the data into the USGS Hydrologic Unit Code (HUC) library tiling format. The Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) has since added critical attributes to the Arizona database, including: A nationally recognized management link code (the Reach Id), names, and hydrologic information. Arizona has enhanced the theme further by adding ergonomic Descriptive Attribute Codes, Cartographic Order, more Names, and intense Quality Assurance Controls.

procstep.procdesc: Digitize paper maps to create data. Perennial waters were described by many specialists in the study of hydrology on quad maps and digitized. There was no ground-truthing done to verify accuracy.

altsys.altenc: Explicit elevation coordinate included with horizontal coordinates

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

enttyp.enttypds: Arizona State Land Department, Arizona Land Resources Information System

attr.attrdef: Length of feature in internal units.

attrdomv.udom: Positive real numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: USGS Cataloging Unit (4th order) of the HUC code
Mile Index. Each SEG starts at 0.0 and increases with river mileage. NOTE: The MILE values were intended to but don't accurately reflect river mileage.

attr.attrdefs: USGS Digital Line Graph major-minor codes.
USGS Digital Line Graph major-minor codes.

attr.attrdef: Cartographic Order. For cartographic filtering, not a stream order.

edom.edomvd: Arizona's major rivers: Colorado, Verde, Salt, Gila, etc.
The main stem of each CU (drainage basin)
All Reach File 2 streams and streams with names.

attr.attrdef: Field added by ALRIS personnel for legend classification purposes.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

distinfo.distliab: Users must assume responsibility to determine the usability of this data for their purposes.

stdorder.fees: Public agencies can utilize the data for cost of media only and no charge for internet downloads. Commercial entities can obtain a cost waiver for contract work for public agencies. Fees will be assessed for purely commercial use of the data.
stdorder.ordering: Contact GIS Data Transfer Specialist for product information and ordering instructions.

distinfo.techpreq: ESRI software or software compatible with ESRI file formats
